title: Album Page, "Sketch for a Navle [sic] Battle (after) van de Velde, Rotterdam", August 19, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, lower right: sketch for a / Navle [sic] Battle / van de Velde / Rotterdam Aug. 19th 1887; upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 9; at lower left corner: 01.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding depicting many large warships surrounded and shrouded by clouds of smoke, likely from cannon and gun fire.  In the foreground two ships are well rendered, each carrying an identicaly striped flag.  In the center background of the scene, sails and the flag of another ship emerge from the smoke.  This ship carries a flag similar to that of the United Kingdom of Great Britain, with the cross of St. George laid over the crosses of St. Andrew and St. Patrick.  The ships all have double masts and full, billowing sails with guns drawn.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sketch for a Navle [sic] Battle (after) van de Velde, Rotterdam", August 19, 1887.
August 19, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-94.
